TEXT_IN_0.description: source text material text_in_0 configure register

TEXT_IN_1.description: source text material text_in_1 configure register

TEXT_IN_2.description: source text material text_in_2 configure register

TEXT_IN_3.description: source text material text_in_3 configure register

TEXT_OUT_0.description: result text material text_out_0 configure register

TEXT_OUT_1.description: result text material text_out_1 configure register

TEXT_OUT_2.description: result text material text_out_2 configure register

TEXT_OUT_3.description: result text material text_out_3 configure register

IV_MEM[%s].description: The memory that stores initialization vector

H_MEM[%s].description: The memory that stores GCM hash subkey

AAD_BLOCK_NUM.description: Additional Authential Data block number register

KEY_0.description: This bits stores key_0 that is a part of key material.

KEY_1.description: This bits stores key_1 that is a part of key material.

KEY_2.description: This bits stores key_2 that is a part of key material.

KEY_3.description: This bits stores key_3 that is a part of key material.

KEY_4.description: This bits stores key_4 that is a part of key material.

KEY_5.description: This bits stores key_5 that is a part of key material.

KEY_6.description: This bits stores key_6 that is a part of key material.

KEY_7.description: This bits stores key_7 that is a part of key material.

TEXT_IN_0.description: This bits stores text_in_0 that is a part of source text material.

TEXT_IN_1.description: This bits stores text_in_1 that is a part of source text material.

TEXT_IN_2.description: This bits stores text_in_2 that is a part of source text material.

TEXT_IN_3.description: This bits stores text_in_3 that is a part of source text material.

TEXT_OUT_0.description: This bits stores text_out_0 that is a part of result text material.

TEXT_OUT_1.description: This bits stores text_out_1 that is a part of result text material.

TEXT_OUT_2.description: This bits stores text_out_2 that is a part of result text material.

TEXT_OUT_3.description: This bits stores text_out_3 that is a part of result text material.

MODE.description: This bits decides which one operation mode will be used. 3'd0: AES-EN-128, 3'd1: AES-EN-192, 3'd2: AES-EN-256, 3'd4: AES-DE-128, 3'd5: AES-DE-192, 3'd6: AES-DE-256.

ENDIAN.description: endian. [1:0] key endian, [3:2] text_in endian or in_stream endian,  [5:4] text_out endian or out_stream endian

TRIGGER.description: Set this bit to start AES calculation.

STATE.description: Those bits shows AES status. For typical AES, 0: idle, 1: busy. For DMA-AES, 0: idle, 1: busy, 2: calculation_done.

DMA_ENABLE.description: 1'b0: typical AES working mode, 1'b1: DMA-AES working mode.

BLOCK_MODE.description: Those bits decides which block mode will be used. 0x0: ECB, 0x1: CBC, 0x2: OFB, 0x3: CTR, 0x4: CFB-8, 0x5: CFB-128, 0x6: GCM, 0x7: reserved.

BLOCK_NUM.description: Those bits stores the number of Plaintext/ciphertext block.

INC_SEL.description: This bit decides the standard incrementing function. 0: INC32. 1: INC128.

AAD_BLOCK_NUM.description: Those bits stores the number of AAD block.

REMAINDER_BIT_NUM.description: Those bits stores the number of remainder bit.

CONTINUE.description: Set this bit to continue GCM operation.

INT_CLEAR.description: Set this bit to clear the AES interrupt.

INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to enable interrupt that occurs when DMA-AES calculation is done.

DATE.description: This bits stores the version information of AES.

DMA_EXIT.description: Set this register to leave calculation done stage. Recommend to use it after software finishes reading DMA's output buffer.

SARADC_SAR_PATT_P_CLEAR.description: clear the pointer of pattern table for DIG ADC1 CTRL

SARADC_XPD_SAR_FORCE.description: force option to xpd sar blocks

SARADC_WAIT_ARB_CYCLE.description: wait arbit signal stable after sar_done

SARADC_SAR1_INV.description: 1: data to DIG ADC1 CTRL is inverted, otherwise not

SARADC_SAR2_INV.description: 1: data to DIG ADC2 CTRL is inverted, otherwise not

SARADC_SAR1_STATUS.description: saradc1 status about data and channel

SARADC_SAR2_STATUS.description: saradc2 status about data and channel

SARADC_SAR_PATT_TAB1.description: item 0 ~ 3 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SARADC_SAR_PATT_TAB2.description: Item 4 ~ 7 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

ADC_ARB_APB_FORCE.description: adc2 arbiter force to enableapb controller

ADC_ARB_RTC_FORCE.description: adc2 arbiter force to enable rtc controller

ADC_ARB_WIFI_FORCE.description: adc2 arbiter force to enable wifi controller

APB_ADC_EOF_NUM.description: the dma_in_suc_eof gen when sample cnt = spi_eof_num

CLK_SEL.description: Set this bit to enable clk_apll

TSENS_XPD_WAIT.description: the time that power up tsens need wait

IN_DONE.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one inlink descriptor has been received for Rx channel 0.

IN_SUC_EOF.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one inlink descriptor has been received for Rx channel 0. For UHCI0, the raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one inlink descriptor has been received and no data error is detected for Rx channel 0.

IN_ERR_EOF.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when data error is detected only in the case that the peripheral is UHCI0 for Rx channel 0. For other peripherals, this raw interrupt is reserved.

OUT_DONE.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one outlink descriptor has been transmitted to peripherals for Tx channel 0.

OUT_EOF.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when the last data pointed by one outlink descriptor has been read from memory for Tx channel 0.

IN_DSCR_ERR.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when detecting inlink descriptor error, including owner error, the second and third word error of inlink descriptor for Rx channel 0.

OUT_DSCR_ERR.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when detecting outlink descriptor error, including owner error, the second and third word error of outlink descriptor for Tx channel 0.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when Rx buffer pointed by inlink is full and receiving data is not completed, but there is no more inlink for Rx channel 0.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF.description: The raw interrupt bit turns to high level when data corresponding a outlink (includes one link descriptor or few link descriptors) is transmitted out for Tx channel 0.

INFIFO_OVF.description: This raw interrupt bit turns to high level when level 1 fifo of Rx channel 0 is overflow.

INFIFO_UDF.description: This raw interrupt bit turns to high level when level 1 fifo of Rx channel 0 is underflow.

OUTFIFO_OVF.description: This raw interrupt bit turns to high level when level 1 fifo of Tx channel 0 is overflow.

OUTFIFO_UDF.description: This raw interrupt bit turns to high level when level 1 fifo of Tx channel 0 is underflow.

AHBM_RST_INTER.description: Set this bit, then clear this bit to reset the internal ahb FSM.

ARB_PRI_DIS.description: Set this bit to disable priority arbitration function.

IN_RST.description: This bit is used to reset DMA channel 0 Rx FSM and Rx FIFO pointer.

INDSCR_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Rx channel 0 reading link descriptor when accessing internal SRAM.

IN_DATA_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Rx channel 0 receiving data when accessing internal SRAM.

MEM_TRANS_EN.description: Set this bit 1 to enable automatic transmitting data from memory to memory via DMA.

IN_CHECK_OWNER.description: Set this bit to enable checking the owner attribute of the link descriptor.

INFIFO_FULL.description: L1 Rx FIFO full signal for Rx channel 0.

INFIFO_EMPTY.description: L1 Rx FIFO empty signal for Rx channel 0.

INFIFO_CNT.description: The register stores the byte number of the data in L1 Rx FIFO for Rx channel 0.

INFIFO_RDATA.description: This register stores the data popping from DMA FIFO.

INFIFO_POP.description: Set this bit to pop data from DMA FIFO.

INLINK_ADDR.description: This register stores the 20 least significant bits of the first inlink descriptor's address.

INLINK_AUTO_RET.description: Set this bit to return to current inlink descriptor's address, when there are some errors in current receiving data.

INLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the inlink descriptors.

INLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the inlink descriptors.

INLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to mount a new inlink descriptor.

INLINK_PARK.description: 1: the inlink descriptor's FSM is in idle state.  0: the inlink descriptor's FSM is working.

INLINK_DSCR_ADDR.description: This register stores the current inlink descriptor's address.

IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the inlink descriptor when the EOF bit in this descriptor is 1.

IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the inlink descriptor when there are some errors in current receiving data. Only used when peripheral is UHCI0.

INLINK_DSCR.description: The address of the current inlink descriptor x.

INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The address of the last inlink descriptor x-1.

INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The address of the second-to-last inlink descriptor x-2.

RX_PRI.description: The priority of Rx channel 0. The larger of the value, the higher of the priority.

PERI_IN_SEL.description: This register is used to select peripheral for Rx channel 0. 0:SPI2. 1: reserved. 2: UHCI0. 3: I2S0. 4: reserved. 5: reserved. 6: AES. 7: SHA. 8: ADC_DAC.

OUT_RST.description: This bit is used to reset DMA channel 0 Tx FSM and Tx FIFO pointer.

OUT_AUTO_WRBACK.description: Set this bit to enable automatic outlink-writeback when all the data in tx buffer has been transmitted.

OUT_EOF_MODE.description: EOF flag generation mode when transmitting data. 1: EOF flag for Tx channel 0 is generated when data need to transmit has been popped from FIFO in DMA

OUTDSCR_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Tx channel 0 reading link descriptor when accessing internal SRAM.

OUT_DATA_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Tx channel 0 transmitting data when accessing internal SRAM.

OUT_CHECK_OWNER.description: Set this bit to enable checking the owner attribute of the link descriptor.

OUTFIFO_FULL.description: L1 Tx FIFO full signal for Tx channel 0.

OUTFIFO_EMPTY.description: L1 Tx FIFO empty signal for Tx channel 0.

OUTFIFO_CNT.description: The register stores the byte number of the data in L1 Tx FIFO for Tx channel 0.

OUTFIFO_WDATA.description: This register stores the data that need to be pushed into DMA FIFO.

OUTFIFO_PUSH.description: Set this bit to push data into DMA FIFO.

OUTLINK_ADDR.description: This register stores the 20 least significant bits of the first outlink descriptor's address.

OUTLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the outlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the outlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to restart a new outlink from the last address.

OUTLINK_PARK.description: 1: the outlink descriptor's FSM is in idle state.  0: the outlink descriptor's FSM is working.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ADDR.description: This register stores the current outlink descriptor's address.

OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the outlink descriptor when the EOF bit in this descriptor is 1.

OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the outlink descriptor before the last outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_DSCR.description: The address of the current outlink descriptor y.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The address of the last outlink descriptor y-1.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The address of the second-to-last inlink descriptor x-2.

TX_PRI.description: The priority of Tx channel 0. The larger of the value, the higher of the priority.

PERI_OUT_SEL.description: This register is used to select peripheral for Tx channel 0. 0:SPI2. 1: reserved. 2: UHCI0. 3: I2S0. 4: reserved. 5: reserved. 6: AES. 7: SHA. 8: ADC_DAC.

IN_RST.description: This bit is used to reset DMA channel 1 Rx FSM and Rx FIFO pointer.

INDSCR_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Rx channel 1 reading link descriptor when accessing internal SRAM.

IN_DATA_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Rx channel 1 receiving data when accessing internal SRAM.

MEM_TRANS_EN.description: Set this bit 1 to enable automatic transmitting data from memory to memory via DMA.

IN_CHECK_OWNER.description: Set this bit to enable checking the owner attribute of the link descriptor.

INFIFO_FULL.description: L1 Rx FIFO full signal for Rx channel 1.

INFIFO_EMPTY.description: L1 Rx FIFO empty signal for Rx channel 1.

INFIFO_CNT.description: The register stores the byte number of the data in L1 Rx FIFO for Rx channel 1.

INFIFO_RDATA.description: This register stores the data popping from DMA FIFO.

INFIFO_POP.description: Set this bit to pop data from DMA FIFO.

INLINK_ADDR.description: This register stores the 20 least significant bits of the first inlink descriptor's address.

INLINK_AUTO_RET.description: Set this bit to return to current inlink descriptor's address, when there are some errors in current receiving data.

INLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the inlink descriptors.

INLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the inlink descriptors.

INLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to mount a new inlink descriptor.

INLINK_PARK.description: 1: the inlink descriptor's FSM is in idle state.  0: the inlink descriptor's FSM is working.

INLINK_DSCR_ADDR.description: This register stores the current inlink descriptor's address.

IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the inlink descriptor when the EOF bit in this descriptor is 1.

IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the inlink descriptor when there are some errors in current receiving data. Only used when peripheral is UHCI0.

INLINK_DSCR.description: The address of the current inlink descriptor x.

INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The address of the last inlink descriptor x-1.

INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The address of the second-to-last inlink descriptor x-2.

RX_PRI.description: The priority of Rx channel 1. The larger of the value, the higher of the priority.

PERI_IN_SEL.description: This register is used to select peripheral for Rx channel 1. 0:SPI2. 1: reserved. 2: UHCI0. 3: I2S0. 4: reserved. 5: reserved. 6: AES. 7: SHA. 8: ADC_DAC.

OUT_RST.description: This bit is used to reset DMA channel 1 Tx FSM and Tx FIFO pointer.

OUT_AUTO_WRBACK.description: Set this bit to enable automatic outlink-writeback when all the data in tx buffer has been transmitted.

OUT_EOF_MODE.description: EOF flag generation mode when transmitting data. 1: EOF flag for Tx channel 1 is generated when data need to transmit has been popped from FIFO in DMA

OUTDSCR_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Tx channel 1 reading link descriptor when accessing internal SRAM.

OUT_DATA_BURST_EN.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable INCR burst transfer for Tx channel 1 transmitting data when accessing internal SRAM.

OUTFIFO_EMPTY.description: L1 Tx FIFO empty signal for Tx channel 1.

OUTFIFO_WDATA.description: This register stores the data that need to be pushed into DMA FIFO.

OUTFIFO_PUSH.description: Set this bit to push data into DMA FIFO.

OUTLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the outlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to restart a new outlink from the last address.

RD_RS_ERR1.description: Programming error record register 1 of BLOCK1-10.

WR_TIM_CONF2.description: Configuration register 2 of eFuse programming timing parameters.

RD_DIS.description: Set this bit to disable reading from BlOCK4-10.

DIS_RTC_RAM_BOOT.description: Set this bit to disable boot from RTC RAM.

DIS_ICACHE.description: Set this bit to disable Icache.

DIS_USB_JTAG.description: Set this bit to disable function of usb switch to jtag in module of usb device.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_ICACHE.description: Set this bit to disable Icache in download mode (boot_mode[3:0] is 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, 7).

DIS_USB_DEVICE.description: Set this bit to disable usb device.

DIS_FORCE_DOWNLOAD.description: Set this bit to disable the function that forces chip into download mode.

DIS_CAN.description: Set this bit to disable CAN function.

JTAG_SEL_ENABLE.description: Set this bit to enable selection between usb_to_jtag and pad_to_jtag through strapping gpio10 when both reg_dis_usb_jtag and reg_dis_pad_jtag are equal to 0.

SOFT_DIS_JTAG.description: Set these bits to disable JTAG in the soft way (odd number 1 means disable ). JTAG can be enabled in HMAC module.

DIS_PAD_JTAG.description: Set this bit to disable JTAG in the hard way. JTAG is disabled permanently.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT.description: Set this bit to disable flash encryption when in download boot modes.

USB_DREFH.description: Controls single-end input threshold vrefh, 1.76 V to 2 V with step of 80 mV, stored in eFuse.

USB_DREFL.description: Controls single-end input threshold vrefl, 0.8 V to 1.04 V with step of 80 mV, stored in eFuse.

USB_EXCHG_PINS.description: Set this bit to exchange USB D+ and D- pins.

VDD_SPI_AS_GPIO.description: Set this bit to vdd spi pin function as gpio.

POWERGLITCH_EN.description: Set this bit to enable power glitch function.

POWER_GLITCH_DSENSE.description: Sample delay configuration of power glitch.

WDT_DELAY_SEL.description: Selects RTC watchdog timeout threshold, in unit of slow clock cycle. 0: 40000. 1: 80000. 2: 160000. 3:320000.

SPI_BOOT_CRYPT_CNT.description: Set this bit to enable SPI boot encrypt/decrypt. Odd number of 1: enable. even number of 1: disable.

SECURE_BOOT_KEY_REVOKE0.description: Set this bit to enable revoking first secure boot key.

SECURE_BOOT_KEY_REVOKE1.description: Set this bit to enable revoking second secure boot key.

SECURE_BOOT_KEY_REVOKE2.description: Set this bit to enable revoking third secure boot key.

SECURE_BOOT_EN.description: Set this bit to enable secure boot.

SECURE_BOOT_AGGRESSIVE_REVOKE.description: Set this bit to enable revoking aggressive secure boot.

FLASH_TPUW.description: Configures flash waiting time after power-up, in unit of ms. If the value is less than 15, the waiting time is the configurable value; Otherwise, the waiting time is twice the configurable value.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MODE.description: Set this bit to disable download mode (boot_mode[3:0] = 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, 7).

DIS_LEGACY_SPI_BOOT.description: Set this bit to disable Legacy SPI boot mode (boot_mode[3:0] = 4).

UART_PRINT_CHANNEL.description: Selectes the default UART print channel. 0: UART0. 1: UART1.

FLASH_ECC_MODE.description: Set ECC mode in ROM, 0: ROM would Enable Flash ECC 16to18 byte mode. 1:ROM would use 16to17 byte mode.

DIS_USB_DOWNLOAD_MODE.description: Set this bit to disable UART download mode through USB.

ENABLE_SECURITY_DOWNLOAD.description: Set this bit to enable secure UART download mode.

UART_PRINT_CONTROL.description: Set the default UARTboot message output mode. 00: Enabled. 01: Enabled when GPIO8 is low at reset. 10: Enabled when GPIO8 is high at reset. 11:disabled.

PIN_POWER_SELECTION.description: GPIO33-GPIO37 power supply selection in ROM code. 0: VDD3P3_CPU. 1: VDD_SPI.

FLASH_TYPE.description: Set the maximum lines of SPI flash. 0: four lines. 1: eight lines.

FLASH_ECC_EN.description: Set 1 to enable ECC for flash boot.

FORCE_SEND_RESUME.description: Set this bit to force ROM code to send a resume command during SPI boot.

SECURE_VERSION.description: Secure version (used by ESP-IDF anti-rollback feature).

MAC_SPI_8M_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of MAC_SPI_8M is reliable 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

SYS_PART1_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

SYS_PART1_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of system part1 is reliable 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

USR_DATA_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

USR_DATA_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the user data is reliable 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

KEY0_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

KEY0_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of key0 is reliable 1: Means that programming key0 failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

KEY1_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

KEY1_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of key1 is reliable 1: Means that programming key1 failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

KEY2_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

KEY2_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of key2 is reliable 1: Means that programming key2 failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

KEY3_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

KEY3_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of key3 is reliable 1: Means that programming key3 failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

KEY4_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

KEY4_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of key4 is reliable 1: Means that programming key4 failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

KEY5_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

KEY5_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of KEY5 is reliable 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

SYS_PART2_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes.

SYS_PART2_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of system part2 is reliable 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 6.

EFUSE_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: Set this bit to force eFuse SRAM into power-saving mode.

MEM_CLK_FORCE_ON.description: Set this bit and force to activate clock signal of eFuse SRAM.

EFUSE_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: Set this bit to force eFuse SRAM into working mode.

EN.description: Set this bit and force to enable clock signal of eFuse memory.

OP_CODE.description: 0x5A5A: Operate programming command 0x5AA5: Operate read command.

STATE.description: Indicates the state of the eFuse state machine.

REPEAT_ERR_CNT.description: Indicates the number of error bits during programming BLOCK0.

READ_CMD.description: Set this bit to send read command.

PGM_CMD.description: Set this bit to send programming command.

BLK_NUM.description: The serial number of the block to be programmed. Value 0-10 corresponds to block number 0-10, respectively.

READ_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear signal for pgm_done interrupt.

DAC_CLK_DIV.description: Controls the division factor of the rising clock of the programming voltage.

DAC_NUM.description: Controls the rising period of the programming voltage.

OE_CLR.description: Reduces the power supply of the programming voltage.

READ_INIT_NUM.description: Configures the initial read time of eFuse.

PWR_ON_NUM.description: Configures the power up time for VDDQ.

PWR_OFF_NUM.description: Configures the power outage time for VDDQ.

ICACHE_ENABLE.description: The bit is used to activate the data cache. 0: disable, 1: enable

ICACHE_SHUT_IBUS.description: The bit is used to disable core0 ibus, 0: enable, 1: disable

ICACHE_SHUT_DBUS.description: The bit is used to disable core1 ibus, 0: enable, 1: disable

ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_ON.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of  icache tag memory. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: The bit is used to power  icache tag memory down, 0: follow rtc_lslp, 1: power down

ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: The bit is used to power  icache tag memory up, 0: follow rtc_lslp, 1: power up

ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT0_EN.description: The bit is used to enable the first section of prelock function.

ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT1_EN.description: The bit is used to enable the second section of prelock function.

ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT0_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the first start virtual address of data prelock, which is combined with ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT0_SIZE_REG

ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT1_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the second start virtual address of data prelock, which is combined with ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT1_SIZE_REG

ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT1_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the second length of data locking, which is combined with ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT1_ADDR_REG

ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT0_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the first length of data locking, which is combined with ICACHE_PRELOCK_SCT0_ADDR_REG

ICACHE_LOCK_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable lock operation. It will be cleared by hardware after lock operation done.

ICACHE_UNLOCK_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable unlock operation. It will be cleared by hardware after unlock operation done.

ICACHE_LOCK_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate unlock/lock operation is finished.

ICACHE_LOCK_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address for lock operations. It should be combined with ICACHE_LOCK_SIZE_REG.

ICACHE_LOCK_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length for lock operations. The bits are the counts of cache block. It should be combined with ICACHE_LOCK_ADDR_REG.

ICACHE_INVALIDATE_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable invalidate operation. It will be cleared by hardware after invalidate operation done.

ICACHE_SYNC_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate invalidate operation is finished.

ICACHE_SYNC_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address for clean operations. It should be combined with ICACHE_SYNC_SIZE_REG.

ICACHE_SYNC_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length for sync operations. The bits are the counts of cache block. It should be combined with ICACHE_SYNC_ADDR_REG.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable preload operation. It will be cleared by hardware after preload operation done.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate preload operation is finished.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_ORDER.description: The bit is used to configure the direction of preload operation. 1: descending, 0: ascending.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address for preload operation. It should be combined with ICACHE_PRELOAD_SIZE_REG.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length for preload operation. The bits are the counts of cache block. It should be combined with ICACHE_PRELOAD_ADDR_REG..

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_ENA.description: The bits are used to enable the first section for autoload operation.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_ENA.description: The bits are used to enable the second section for autoload operation.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable and disable autoload operation. It is combined with icache_autoload_done. 1: enable, 0: disable.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate autoload operation is finished.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_ORDER.description: The bits are used to configure the direction of autoload. 1: descending, 0: ascending.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_RQST.description: The bits are used to configure trigger conditions for autoload. 0/3: cache miss, 1: cache hit, 2: both cache miss and hit.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of the first section for autoload operation. It should be combined with icache_autoload_sct0_ena.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length of the first section for autoload operation. It should be combined with icache_autoload_sct0_ena.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of the second section for autoload operation. It should be combined with icache_autoload_sct1_ena.

ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length of the second section for autoload operation. It should be combined with icache_autoload_sct1_ena.

IBUS_TO_FLASH_START_VADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of ibus to access flash. The register is used to give constraints to ibus access counter.

IBUS_TO_FLASH_END_VADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the end virtual address of ibus to access flash. The register is used to give constraints to ibus access counter.

DBUS_TO_FLASH_START_VADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of dbus to access flash. The register is used to give constraints to dbus access counter.

DBUS_TO_FLASH_END_VADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the end virtual address of dbus to access flash. The register is used to give constraints to dbus access counter.

IBUS_ACS_CNT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear ibus counter.

DBUS_ACS_CNT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear dbus counter.

IBUS_ACS_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the cache miss caused by ibus access flash.

IBUS_ACS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of ibus access flash through icache.

DBUS_ACS_FLASH_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the cache miss caused by dbus access flash.

DBUS_ACS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of dbus access flash through icache.

ICACHE_SYNC_OP_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by sync configurations fault.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_OP_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by preload configurations fault.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by mmu entry fault.

IBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by ibus counter overflow.

DBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by dbus counter overflow.

ICACHE_SYNC_OP_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by sync configurations fault.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_OP_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by preload configurations fault.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by mmu entry fault.

IBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by ibus counter overflow.

DBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by dbus counter overflow.

ICACHE_SYNC_OP_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by sync configurations fault.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_OP_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by preload configurations fault.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by mmu entry fault.

IBUS_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus access flash/spiram counter overflow.

IBUS_ACS_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus access flash/spiram miss counter overflow.

DBUS_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus access flash/spiram counter overflow.

DBUS_ACS_FLASH_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus access flash miss counter overflow.

CORE0_IBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding ibus is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_IBUS_WR_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by ibus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_REJECT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding dbus is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_DBUS_REJECT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_WR_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by dbus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding ibus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_IBUS_WR_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by ibus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_REJECT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding dbus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_DBUS_REJECT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_WR_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by dbus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_ACS_MSK_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access  icache while the core0_ibus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_IBUS_WR_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus trying to write icache

CORE0_IBUS_REJECT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_ACS_MSK_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access icache while the core0_dbus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

CORE0_DBUS_REJECT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by authentication fail.

CORE0_DBUS_WR_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus trying to write icache

CORE0_DBUS_ATTR.description: The bits are used to indicate the attribute of CPU access dbus when authentication fail. 0: invalidate, 1: execute-able, 2: read-able, 4: write-able.

CORE0_DBUS_WORLD.description: The bit is used to indicate the world of CPU access dbus when authentication fail. 0: WORLD0, 1: WORLD1

CORE0_DBUS_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address of CPU access dbus when authentication fail.

CORE0_IBUS_ATTR.description: The bits are used to indicate the attribute of CPU access ibus when authentication fail. 0: invalidate, 1: execute-able, 2: read-able

CORE0_IBUS_WORLD.description: The bit is used to indicate the world of CPU access ibus when authentication fail. 0: WORLD0, 1: WORLD1

CORE0_IBUS_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address of CPU access  ibus when authentication fail.

CACHE_MMU_FAULT_CONTENT.description: The bits are used to indicate the content of mmu entry which cause mmu fault..

CACHE_MMU_FAULT_CODE.description: The right-most 3 bits are used to indicate the operations which cause mmu fault occurrence. 0: default, 1: cpu miss, 2: preload miss, 3: writeback, 4: cpu miss evict recovery address, 5: load miss evict recovery address, 6: external dma tx, 7: external dma rx. The most significant bit is used to indicate this operation occurs in which one icache.

CACHE_MMU_FAULT_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address which cause mmu fault..

CACHE_FLASH_WRAP_AROUND.description: The bit is used to enable wrap around mode when read data from flash.

CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_ON.description: The bit is used to enable clock gating to save power when access mmu memory, 0: enable, 1: disable

CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: The bit is used to power mmu memory down, 0: follow_rtc_lslp_pd, 1: power down

CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: The bit is used to power mmu memory down, 0: follow_rtc_lslp_pd, 1: power up

ICACHE_STATE.description: The bit is used to indicate whether  icache main fsm is in idle state or not. 1: in idle state,  0: not in idle state

CLK_FORCE_ON_MANUAL_CRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of manual crypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

CLK_FORCE_ON_AUTO_CRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of automatic crypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

CLK_FORCE_ON_CRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of external memory encrypt and decrypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate the interrupt by  icache pre-load done.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt by  icache pre-load done.

ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear the interrupt by  icache pre-load done.

ICACHE_SYNC_INT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate the interrupt by  icache sync done.

ICACHE_SYNC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt by  icache sync done.

ICACHE_SYNC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear the interrupt by  icache sync done.

CACHE_MMU_OWNER.description: The bits are used to specify the owner of MMU.bit0/bit2: ibus, bit1/bit3: dbus

CACHE_IGNORE_PRELOAD_MMU_ENTRY_FAULT.description: The bit is used to disable checking mmu entry fault by preload operation.

CACHE_IGNORE_SYNC_MMU_ENTRY_FAULT.description: The bit is used to disable checking mmu entry fault by sync operation.

CACHE_TRACE_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable cache trace function.

ENA.description: The bit is used to enable icache freeze mode

MODE.description: The bit is used to configure freeze mode, 0:  assert busy if CPU miss 1: assert hit if CPU miss

DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate icache freeze success

ICACHE_ATOMIC_OPERATE_ENA.description: The bit is used to activate icache atomic operation protection. In this case, sync/lock operation can not interrupt miss-work. This feature does not work during invalidateAll operation.

BYPASS.description: The bit is used to disable request recording which could cause performance issue

IBUS_PMS_LOCK.description: The bit is used to configure the ibus permission control section boundary0

IBUS_PMS_BOUNDARY0.description: The bit is used to configure the ibus permission control section boundary0

IBUS_PMS_BOUNDARY1.description: The bit is used to configure the ibus permission control section boundary1

IBUS_PMS_BOUNDARY2.description: The bit is used to configure the ibus permission control section boundary2

IBUS_PMS_SCT1_ATTR.description: The bit is used to configure attribute of the ibus permission control section1, bit0: fetch in world0, bit1: load in world0, bit2: fetch in world1, bit3: load in world1

IBUS_PMS_SCT2_ATTR.description: The bit is used to configure attribute of the ibus permission control section2, bit0: fetch in world0, bit1: load in world0, bit2: fetch in world1, bit3: load in world1

DBUS_PMS_LOCK.description: The bit is used to configure the ibus permission control section boundary0

DBUS_PMS_BOUNDARY0.description: The bit is used to configure the dbus permission control section boundary0

DBUS_PMS_BOUNDARY1.description: The bit is used to configure the dbus permission control section boundary1

DBUS_PMS_BOUNDARY2.description: The bit is used to configure the dbus permission control section boundary2

DBUS_PMS_SCT1_ATTR.description: The bit is used to configure attribute of the dbus permission control section1, bit0: load in world0, bit2: load in world1

DBUS_PMS_SCT2_ATTR.description: The bit is used to configure attribute of the dbus permission control section2, bit0: load in world0, bit2: load in world1

PCPU_NMI_INT.description: GPIO PRO_CPU(not shielded) interrupt status register

OUT_W1TS.description: GPIO output set register for GPIO0-25

OUT_W1TC.description: GPIO output clear register for GPIO0-25

DATA.description: GPIO output enable register for GPIO0-25

ENABLE_W1TS.description: GPIO output enable set register for GPIO0-25

ENABLE_W1TC.description: GPIO output enable clear register for GPIO0-25

INTERRUPT.description: GPIO interrupt status register for GPIO0-25

STATUS_W1TS.description: GPIO interrupt status set register for GPIO0-25

STATUS_W1TC.description: GPIO interrupt status clear register for GPIO0-25

PROCPU_INT.description: GPIO PRO_CPU interrupt status register for GPIO0-25

PROCPU_NMI_INT.description: GPIO PRO_CPU(not shielded) interrupt status register for GPIO0-25

SDIO_INT.description: GPIO CPUSDIO interrupt status register for GPIO0-25

SYNC2_BYPASS.description: set GPIO input_sync2 signal mode. 0:disable. 1:trigger at negedge. 2or3:trigger at posedge.

PAD_DRIVER.description: set this bit to select pad driver. 1:open-drain. 0:normal.

SYNC1_BYPASS.description: set GPIO input_sync1 signal mode. 0:disable. 1:trigger at negedge. 2or3:trigger at posedge.

INT_TYPE.description: set this value to choose interrupt mode. 0:disable GPIO interrupt. 1:trigger at posedge. 2:trigger at negedge. 3:trigger at any edge. 4:valid at low level. 5:valid at high level

WAKEUP_ENABLE.description: set this bit to enable GPIO wakeup.(can only wakeup CPU from Light-sleep Mode)

INT_ENA.description: set bit 13 to enable CPU interrupt. set bit 14 to enable CPU(not shielded) interrupt.

STATUS_INTERRUPT_NEXT.description: GPIO interrupt source register for GPIO0-25

IN_SEL.description: set this value: s=0-53: connect GPIO[s] to this port. s=0x38: set this port always high level. s=0x3C: set this port always low level.

IN_INV_SEL.description: set this bit to invert input signal. 1:invert. 0:not invert.

SEL.description: set this bit to bypass GPIO. 1:do not bypass GPIO. 0:bypass GPIO.

OUT_SEL.description: The value of the bits: 0<=s<=256. Set the value to select output signal. s=0-255: output of GPIO[n] equals input of peripheral[s]. s=256: output of GPIO[n] equals GPIO_OUT_REG[n].

INV_SEL.description: set this bit to invert output signal.1:invert.0:not invert.

OEN_SEL.description: set this bit to select output enable signal.1:use GPIO_ENABLE_REG[n] as output enable signal.0:use peripheral output enable signal.

OEN_INV_SEL.description: set this bit to invert output enable signal.1:invert.0:not invert.

CLK_EN.description: set this bit to enable GPIO clock gate

RX_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset receiver

RX_FIFO_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset Rx AFIFO

RX_START.description: Set this bit to start receiving data

RX_SLAVE_MOD.description: Set this bit to enable slave receiver mode

RX_MONO.description: Set this bit to enable receiver  in mono mode

RX_BIG_ENDIAN.description: I2S Rx byte endian, 1: low addr value to high addr. 0: low addr with low addr value.

RX_UPDATE.description: Set 1 to update I2S RX registers from APB clock domain to I2S RX clock domain. This bit will be cleared by hardware after update register done.

RX_MONO_FST_VLD.description: 1: The first channel data value is valid in I2S RX mono mode.   0: The second channel data value is valid in I2S RX mono mode.

RX_PCM_CONF.description: I2S RX compress/decompress configuration bit. & 0 (atol): A-Law decompress, 1 (ltoa) : A-Law compress, 2 (utol) : u-Law decompress, 3 (ltou) : u-Law compress. &

RX_PCM_BYPASS.description: Set this bit to bypass Compress/Decompress module for received data.

RX_STOP_MODE.description: 0  : I2S Rx only stop when reg_rx_start is cleared.   1: Stop when reg_rx_start is 0 or in_suc_eof is 1.   2:  Stop I2S RX when reg_rx_start is 0 or RX FIFO is full.

RX_LEFT_ALIGN.description: 1: I2S RX left alignment mode. 0: I2S RX right alignment mode.

RX_24_FILL_EN.description: 1: store 24 channel bits to 32 bits. 0:store 24 channel bits to 24 bits.

RX_WS_IDLE_POL.description: 0: WS should be 0 when receiving left channel data, and WS is 1in right channel.  1: WS should be 1 when receiving left channel data, and WS is 0in right channel.

RX_BIT_ORDER.description: I2S Rx bit endian. 1:small endian, the LSB is received first. 0:big endian, the MSB is received first.

RX_TDM_EN.description: 1: Enable I2S TDM Rx mode . 0: Disable.

RX_PDM_EN.description: 1: Enable I2S PDM Rx mode . 0: Disable.

TX_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset transmitter

TX_FIFO_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset Tx AFIFO

TX_START.description: Set this bit to start transmitting data

TX_SLAVE_MOD.description: Set this bit to enable slave transmitter mode

TX_MONO.description: Set this bit to enable transmitter in mono mode

TX_CHAN_EQUAL.description: 1: The value of Left channel data is equal to the value of right channel data in I2S TX mono mode or TDM channel select mode. 0: The invalid channel data is reg_i2s_single_data in I2S TX mono mode or TDM channel select mode.

TX_BIG_ENDIAN.description: I2S Tx byte endian, 1: low addr value to high addr.  0: low addr with low addr value.

TX_UPDATE.description: Set 1 to update I2S TX registers from APB clock domain to I2S TX clock domain. This bit will be cleared by hardware after update register done.

TX_MONO_FST_VLD.description: 1: The first channel data value is valid in I2S TX mono mode.   0: The second channel data value is valid in I2S TX mono mode.

TX_PCM_CONF.description: I2S TX compress/decompress configuration bit. & 0 (atol): A-Law decompress, 1 (ltoa) : A-Law compress, 2 (utol) : u-Law decompress, 3 (ltou) : u-Law compress. &

TX_PCM_BYPASS.description: Set this bit to bypass  Compress/Decompress module for transmitted data.

TX_STOP_EN.description: Set this bit to stop disable output BCK signal and WS signal when tx FIFO is emtpy

TX_LEFT_ALIGN.description: 1: I2S TX left alignment mode. 0: I2S TX right alignment mode.

TX_24_FILL_EN.description: 1: Sent 32 bits in 24 channel bits mode. 0: Sent 24 bits in 24 channel bits mode

TX_WS_IDLE_POL.description: 0: WS should be 0 when sending left channel data, and WS is 1in right channel.  1: WS should be 1 when sending left channel data, and WS is 0in right channel.

TX_BIT_ORDER.description: I2S Tx bit endian. 1:small endian, the LSB is sent first. 0:big endian, the MSB is sent first.

TX_TDM_EN.description: 1: Enable I2S TDM Tx mode . 0: Disable.

TX_PDM_EN.description: 1: Enable I2S PDM Tx mode . 0: Disable.

TX_CHAN_MOD.description: I2S transmitter channel mode configuration bits.

SIG_LOOPBACK.description: Enable signal loop back mode with transmitter module and receiver module sharing the same WS and BCK signals.

RX_TDM_WS_WIDTH.description: The width of rx_ws_out in TDM mode is (I2S_RX_TDM_WS_WIDTH[6:0] +1) * T_bck

RX_BCK_DIV_NUM.description: Bit clock configuration bits in receiver mode.

RX_BITS_MOD.description: Set the bits to configure the valid data bit length of I2S receiver channel. 7: all the valid channel data is in 8-bit-mode. 15: all the valid channel data is in 16-bit-mode. 23: all the valid channel data is in 24-bit-mode. 31:all the valid channel data is in 32-bit-mode.

RX_TDM_CHAN_BITS.description: The Rx bit number for each channel minus 1in TDM mode.

RX_MSB_SHIFT.description: Set this bit to enable receiver in Phillips standard mode

TX_TDM_WS_WIDTH.description: The width of tx_ws_out in TDM mode is (I2S_TX_TDM_WS_WIDTH[6:0] +1) * T_bck

TX_BCK_DIV_NUM.description: Bit clock configuration bits in transmitter mode.

TX_BITS_MOD.description: Set the bits to configure the valid data bit length of I2S transmitter channel. 7: all the valid channel data is in 8-bit-mode. 15: all the valid channel data is in 16-bit-mode. 23: all the valid channel data is in 24-bit-mode. 31:all the valid channel data is in 32-bit-mode.

TX_TDM_CHAN_BITS.description: The Tx bit number for each channel minus 1in TDM mode.

TX_MSB_SHIFT.description: Set this bit to enable transmitter in Phillips standard mode

TX_BCK_NO_DLY.description: 1: BCK is not delayed to generate pos/neg edge in master mode. 0: BCK is delayed to generate pos/neg edge in master mode.

RX_CLK_ACTIVE.description: I2S Rx module clock enable signal.

RX_CLK_SEL.description: Select I2S Rx module source clock. 0: no clock. 1: APLL. 2: CLK160. 3: I2S_MCLK_in.

MCLK_SEL.description: 0: UseI2S Tx module clock as I2S_MCLK_OUT.  1: UseI2S Rx module clock as I2S_MCLK_OUT.

TX_CLKM_DIV_NUM.description: Integral I2S TX clock divider value. f_I2S_CLK = f_I2S_CLK_S/(N+b/a). There will be (a-b) * n-div and b * (n+1)-div.  So the average combination will be:  for b <= a/2, z * [x * n-div + (n+1)-div] + y * n-div. For b > a/2, z * [n-div + x * (n+1)-div] + y * (n+1)-div.

TX_CLK_ACTIVE.description: I2S Tx module clock enable signal.

TX_CLK_SEL.description: Select I2S Tx module source clock. 0: XTAL clock. 1: APLL. 2: CLK160. 3: I2S_MCLK_in.

CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clk gate

RX_CLKM_DIV_Z.description: For b <= a/2, the value of I2S_RX_CLKM_DIV_Z is b. For b > a/2, the value of I2S_RX_CLKM_DIV_Z is (a-b).

RX_CLKM_DIV_Y.description: For b <= a/2, the value of I2S_RX_CLKM_DIV_Y is (a%b) . For b > a/2, the value of I2S_RX_CLKM_DIV_Y is (a%(a-b)).

RX_CLKM_DIV_X.description: For b <= a/2, the value of I2S_RX_CLKM_DIV_X is (a/b) - 1. For b > a/2, the value of I2S_RX_CLKM_DIV_X is (a/(a-b)) - 1.

RX_CLKM_DIV_YN1.description: For b <= a/2, the value of I2S_RX_CLKM_DIV_YN1 is 0 . For b > a/2, the value of I2S_RX_CLKM_DIV_YN1 is 1.

TX_CLKM_DIV_Z.description: For b <= a/2, the value of I2S_TX_CLKM_DIV_Z is b. For b > a/2, the value of I2S_TX_CLKM_DIV_Z is (a-b).

TX_CLKM_DIV_Y.description: For b <= a/2, the value of I2S_TX_CLKM_DIV_Y is (a%b) . For b > a/2, the value of I2S_TX_CLKM_DIV_Y is (a%(a-b)).

TX_CLKM_DIV_X.description: For b <= a/2, the value of I2S_TX_CLKM_DIV_X is (a/b) - 1. For b > a/2, the value of I2S_TX_CLKM_DIV_X is (a/(a-b)) - 1.

TX_CLKM_DIV_YN1.description: For b <= a/2, the value of I2S_TX_CLKM_DIV_YN1 is 0 . For b > a/2, the value of I2S_TX_CLKM_DIV_YN1 is 1.

LSLP_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: memories in digital core force PD in sleep

LSLP_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: memories in digital core force PU in sleep

CLR_DG_PAD_AUTOHOLD.description: wtite only register to clear digital pad auto-hold

SWD_SIGNAL_WIDTH.description: adjust signal width send to swd

SWD_AUTO_FEED_EN.description: automatically feed swd when int comes

TOUCH_STATE_SWITCH.description: touch is about to working. Switch rtc main state

COCPU_STATE_SWITCH.description: ulp/cocpu is about to working. Switch rtc main state

DET.description: the flag of brown det from analog

XTAL32K_CLK_FACTOR.description: xtal 32k watch dog backup clock factor

POWER_GLITCH_EFUSE_SEL.description: use efuse value control power glitch enable

DIN_MODE.description: SPI0 input delay mode control register

DIN_NUM.description: SPI0 input delay number control register

DOUT_MODE.description: SPI0 output delay mode control register

FDUMMY_OUT.description: In the dummy phase the signal level of spi is output by the spi controller.

FCMD_DUAL.description: Apply 2 signals during command phase 1:enable 0: disable

FCMD_QUAD.description: Apply 4 signals during command phase 1:enable 0: disable

FASTRD_MODE.description: This bit enable the bits: spi_mem_fread_qio, spi_mem_fread_dio, spi_mem_fread_qout and spi_mem_fread_dout. 1: enable 0: disable.

FREAD_DUAL.description: In the read operations, read-data phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

Q_POL.description: The bit is used to set MISO line polarity, 1: high 0, low

D_POL.description: The bit is used to set MOSI line polarity, 1: high 0, low

FREAD_QUAD.description: In the read operations read-data phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

WP.description: Write protect signal output when SPI is idle.  1: output high, 0: output low.

FREAD_DIO.description: In the read operations address phase and read-data phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

FREAD_QIO.description: In the read operations address phase and read-data phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.

CLK_MODE.description: SPI clock mode bits. 0: SPI clock is off when CS inactive 1: SPI clock is delayed one cycle after CS inactive 2: SPI clock is delayed two cycles after CS inactive 3: SPI clock is alwasy on.

CS_SETUP_TIME.description: (cycles-1) of prepare phase by spi clock this bits are combined with spi_mem_cs_setup bit.

CS_HOLD_TIME.description: Spi cs signal is delayed to inactive by spi clock this bits are combined with spi_mem_cs_hold bit.

CS_HOLD_DELAY.description: These bits are used to set the minimum CS high time tSHSL between SPI burst transfer when accesses to flash. tSHSL is (SPI_MEM_CS_HOLD_DELAY[5:0] + 1) MSPI core clock cycles.

CLKCNT_L.description: In the master mode it must be equal to spi_mem_clkcnt_N.

CLKCNT_H.description: In the master mode it must be floor((spi_mem_clkcnt_N+1)/2-1).

CLKCNT_N.description: In the master mode it is the divider of spi_mem_clk. So spi_mem_clk frequency is system/(spi_mem_clkcnt_N+1)

CS_HOLD.description: spi cs keep low when spi is in  done  phase. 1: enable 0: disable.

CS_SETUP.description: spi cs is enable when spi is in  prepare  phase. 1: enable 0: disable.

CK_OUT_EDGE.description: the bit combined with spi_mem_mosi_delay_mode bits to set mosi signal delay mode.

USR_DUMMY_IDLE.description: spi clock is disable in dummy phase when the bit is enable.

USR_DUMMY.description: This bit enable the dummy phase of an operation.

USR_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: The length in spi_mem_clk cycles of dummy phase. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1).

USR_ADDR_BITLEN.description: The length in bits of address phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1).

USR_COMMAND_BITLEN.description: The length in bits of command phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1)

WB_MODE.description: Mode bits in the flash fast read mode  it is combined with spi_mem_fastrd_mode bit.

TRANS_END.description: The bit is used to indicate the  spi0_mst_st controlled transmitting is done.

TRANS_END_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt of  spi0_mst_st controlled transmitting is done.

CSPI_ST_TRANS_END.description: The bit is used to indicate the  spi0_slv_st controlled transmitting is done.

CSPI_ST_TRANS_END_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt of spi0_slv_st controlled transmitting is done.

CK_IDLE_EDGE.description: 1: spi clk line is high when idle     0: spi clk line is low when idle

CS_KEEP_ACTIVE.description: spi cs line keep low when the bit is set.

CACHE_REQ_EN.description: For SPI0, Cache access enable, 1: enable, 0:disable.

CACHE_USR_ADDR_4BYTE.description: For SPI0,  cache  read flash with 4 bytes address, 1: enable, 0:disable.

CACHE_FLASH_USR_CMD.description: For SPI0,  cache  read flash for user define command, 1: enable, 0:disable.

FDIN_DUAL.description: For SPI0 flash, din phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable. The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_dio.

FDOUT_DUAL.description: For SPI0 flash, dout phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable. The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_dio.

FADDR_DUAL.description: For SPI0 flash, address phase apply 2 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.  The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_dio.

FDIN_QUAD.description: For SPI0 flash, din phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.  The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_qio.

FDOUT_QUAD.description: For SPI0 flash, dout phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.  The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_qio.

FADDR_QUAD.description: For SPI0 flash, address phase apply 4 signals. 1: enable 0: disable.  The bit is the same with spi_mem_fread_qio.

CSPI_ST.description: The current status of SPI0 slave FSM: spi0_slv_st. 0: idle state, 1: preparation state, 2: send command state, 3: send address state, 4: wait state, 5: read data state, 6:write data state, 7: done state, 8: read data end state.

EM_ST.description: The current status of SPI0 master FSM: spi0_mst_st. 0: idle state, 1:EM_CACHE_GRANT , 2: program/erase suspend state, 3: SPI0 read data state, 4: wait cache/EDMA sent data is stored in SPI0 TX FIFO, 5: SPI0 write data state.

CSPI_LOCK_DELAY_TIME.description: The lock delay time of SPI0/1 arbiter by spi0_slv_st, after PER is sent by SPI1.

TIMING_CLK_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable timing adjust clock for all reading operations.

TIMING_CALI.description: The bit is used to enable timing auto-calibration for all reading operations.

EXTRA_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: add extra dummy spi clock cycle length for spi clock calibration.

DIN0_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb,  3: input with the posedge of clk_160, 4 input with the negedge of clk_160, 5: input with the spi_clk high edge,  6: input with the spi_clk low edge

DIN1_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb,  3: input with the posedge of clk_160, 4 input with the negedge of clk_160, 5: input with the spi_clk high edge,  6: input with the spi_clk low edge

DIN2_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb,  3: input with the posedge of clk_160, 4 input with the negedge of clk_160, 5: input with the spi_clk high edge,  6: input with the spi_clk low edge

DIN3_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb,  3: input with the posedge of clk_160, 4 input with the negedge of clk_160, 5: input with the spi_clk high edge,  6: input with the spi_clk low edge

DIN0_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...

DIN1_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...

DIN2_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...

DIN3_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...

DOUT0_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the posedge of clk_160,4 output with the negedge of clk_160,5: output with the spi_clk high edge ,6: output with the spi_clk low edge

DOUT1_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the posedge of clk_160,4 output with the negedge of clk_160,5: output with the spi_clk high edge ,6: output with the spi_clk low edge

DOUT2_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the posedge of clk_160,4 output with the negedge of clk_160,5: output with the spi_clk high edge ,6: output with the spi_clk low edge

DOUT3_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the posedge of clk_160,4 output with the negedge of clk_160,5: output with the spi_clk high edge ,6: output with the spi_clk low edge

CLK_EN.description: Register clock gate enable signal. 1: Enable. 0: Disable.

SPI01_CLK_SEL.description: When the digital system clock selects PLL clock and the frequency of PLL clock is 480MHz, the value of reg_spi01_clk_sel:  0: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) is 80MHz. 1: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) is 120MHz.  2: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) 160MHz. 3: Not used. When the digital system clock selects PLL clock and the frequency of PLL clock is 320MHz, the value of reg_spi01_clk_sel:  0: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) is 80MHz. 1: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) is 80MHz.  2: SPI0/1 module clock (clk) 160MHz. 3: Not used.

TIMER_UNIT1_CORE1_STALL_EN.description: If timer unit1 is stalled when core1 stalled

TIMER_UNIT1_CORE0_STALL_EN.description: If timer unit1 is stalled when core0 stalled

TIMER_UNIT0_CORE1_STALL_EN.description: If timer unit0 is stalled when core1 stalled

TIMER_UNIT0_CORE0_STALL_EN.description: If timer unit0 is stalled when core0 stalled

TIMER_UNIT1_VALUE_VALID.description: timer value is sync and valid

RESET_MODE.description: This bit is used to configure the operating mode of the TWAI Controller. 1: Reset mode; 0: Operating mode.

LISTEN_ONLY_MODE.description: 1: Listen only mode. In this mode the nodes will only receive messages from the bus, without generating the acknowledge signal nor updating the RX error counter.

SELF_TEST_MODE.description: 1: Self test mode. In this mode the TX nodes can perform a successful transmission without receiving the acknowledge signal. This mode is often used to test a single node with the self reception request command.

RX_FILTER_MODE.description: This bit is used to configure the filter mode. 0: Dual filter mode; 1: Single filter mode.

TX_REQ.description: Set the bit to 1 to allow the driving nodes start transmission.

ABORT_TX.description: Set the bit to 1 to cancel a pending transmission request.

RELEASE_BUF.description: Set the bit to 1 to release the RX buffer.

CLR_OVERRUN.description: Set the bit to 1 to clear the data overrun status bit.

SELF_RX_REQ.description: Self reception request command. Set the bit to 1 to allow a message be transmitted and received simultaneously.

RX_BUF_ST.description: 1: The data in the RX buffer is not empty, with at least one received data packet.

OVERRUN_ST.description: 1: The RX FIFO is full and data overrun has occurred.

TX_BUF_ST.description: 1: The TX buffer is empty, the CPU may write a message into it.

TX_COMPLETE.description: 1: The TWAI controller has successfully received a packet from the bus.

RX_ST.description: 1: The TWAI Controller is receiving a message from the bus.

TX_ST.description: 1: The TWAI Controller is transmitting a message to the bus.

ERR_ST.description: 1: At least one of the RX/TX error counter has reached or exceeded the value set in register TWAI_ERR_WARNING_LIMIT_REG.

BUS_OFF_ST.description: 1: In bus-off status, the TWAI Controller is no longer involved in bus activities.

MISS_ST.description: This bit reflects whether the data packet in the RX FIFO is complete. 1: The current packet is missing; 0: The current packet is complete

RX_INT_ST.description: Receive interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates there are messages to be handled in the RX FIFO.

TX_INT_ST.description: Transmit interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the message transmitting mis- sion is finished and a new transmission is able to execute.

ERR_WARN_INT_ST.description: Error warning interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the error status signal and the bus-off status signal of Status register have changed (e.g., switched from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0).

OVERRUN_INT_ST.description: Data overrun interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates a data overrun interrupt is generated in the RX FIFO.

ERR_PASSIVE_INT_ST.description: Error passive interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the TWAI Controller is switched between error active status and error passive status due to the change of error counters.

ARB_LOST_INT_ST.description: Arbitration lost interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates an arbitration lost interrupt is generated.

BUS_ERR_INT_ST.description: Error interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates an error is detected on the bus.

RX_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable receive interrupt.

TX_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable transmit interrupt.

ERR_WARN_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error warning interrupt.

OVERRUN_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable data overrun interrupt.

ERR_PASSIVE_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error passive interrupt.

ARB_LOST_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable arbitration lost interrupt.

BUS_ERR_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error interrupt.

BAUD_PRESC.description: Baud Rate Prescaler, determines the frequency dividing ratio.

TIME_SAMP.description: The number of sample points. 0: the bus is sampled once; 1: the bus is sampled three times

ARB_LOST_CAP.description: This register contains information about the bit position of lost arbitration.

ECC_SEGMENT.description: This register contains information about the location of errors, see Table 181 for details.

ECC_DIRECTION.description: This register contains information about transmission direction of the node when error occurs. 1: Error occurs when receiving a message; 0: Error occurs when transmitting a message

ECC_TYPE.description: This register contains information about error types: 00: bit error; 01: form error; 10: stuff error; 11: other type of error

ERR_WARNING_LIMIT.description: Error warning threshold. In the case when any of a error counter value exceeds the threshold, or all the error counter values are below the threshold, an error warning interrupt will be triggered (given the enable signal is valid).

RX_ERR_CNT.description: The RX error counter register, reflects value changes under reception status.

TX_ERR_CNT.description: The TX error counter register, reflects value changes under transmission status.

TX_BYTE_0.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 0 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 0th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_1.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 1 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 1st byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_2.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 2 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 2nd byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_3.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 3 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 3rd byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_4.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 4 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 4th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_5.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 5 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 5th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_6.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 6 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 6th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_7.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 7 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 7th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_8.description: In operation mode, it stores the 8th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_9.description: In operation mode, it stores the 9th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_10.description: In operation mode, it stores the 10th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_11.description: In operation mode, it stores the 11th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

TX_BYTE_12.description: In operation mode, it stores the 12th byte of the data to be transmitted or received. In operation mode, writing writes to the transmit buffer while reading reads from the receive buffer.

RX_MESSAGE_COUNTER.description: This register reflects the number of messages available within the RX FIFO.

CD.description: These bits are used to configure frequency dividing coefficients of the external CLKOUT pin.

CLOCK_OFF.description: This bit can be configured under reset mode. 1: Disable the external CLKOUT pin; 0: Enable the external CLKOUT pin

LOWPULSE.description: Autobaud minimum low pulse duration register

HIGHPULSE.description: Autobaud minimum high pulse duration register

MEM_TX_STATUS.description: Tx-FIFO write and read offset address.

MEM_RX_STATUS.description: Rx-FIFO write and read offset address.

RXFIFO_RD_BYTE.description: UART 0 accesses FIFO via this register.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives more data than what rxfifo_full_thrhd specifies.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the amount of data in Tx-FIFO is less than what txfifo_empty_thrhd specifies .

PARITY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a parity error in the data.

FRM_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a data frame error .

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives more data than the FIFO can store.

DSR_CHG_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the edge change of DSRn signal.

CTS_CHG_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the edge change of CTSn signal.

BRK_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a 0 after the stop bit.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver takes more time than rx_tout_thrhd to receive a byte.

SW_XON_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver recevies Xon char when uart_sw_flow_con_en is set to 1.

SW_XOFF_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver receives Xoff char when uart_sw_flow_con_en is set to 1.

GLITCH_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a glitch in the middle of a start bit.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter completes  sending  NULL characters, after all data in Tx-FIFO are sent.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter has kept the shortest duration after sending the  last data.

TX_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when transmitter has send out all data in FIFO.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a parity error from the echo of transmitter in rs485 mode.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects a data frame error from the echo of transmitter in rs485 mode.

RS485_CLASH_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when detects a clash between transmitter and receiver in rs485 mode.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when receiver detects the configured at_cmd char.

WAKEUP_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when input rxd edge changes more times than what reg_active_threshold specifies in light sleeping mode.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_full_int_raw when rxfifo_full_int_ena is set to 1.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for  txfifo_empty_int_raw  when txfifo_empty_int_ena is set to 1.

PARITY_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for parity_err_int_raw when parity_err_int_ena is set to 1.

FRM_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for frm_err_int_raw when frm_err_int_ena is set to 1.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_ovf_int_raw when rxfifo_ovf_int_ena is set to 1.

DSR_CHG_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for dsr_chg_int_raw when dsr_chg_int_ena is set to 1.

CTS_CHG_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for cts_chg_int_raw when cts_chg_int_ena is set to 1.

BRK_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for brk_det_int_raw when brk_det_int_ena is set to 1.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rxfifo_tout_int_raw when rxfifo_tout_int_ena is set to 1.

SW_XON_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for sw_xon_int_raw when sw_xon_int_ena is set to 1.

SW_XOFF_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for sw_xoff_int_raw when sw_xoff_int_ena is set to 1.

GLITCH_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for glitch_det_int_raw when glitch_det_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for tx_brk_done_int_raw when tx_brk_done_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the stauts bit for tx_brk_idle_done_int_raw when tx_brk_idle_done_int_ena is set to 1.

TX_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for tx_done_int_raw when tx_done_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_parity_err_int_raw when rs485_parity_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_frm_err_int_raw when rs485_fm_err_int_ena is set to 1.

RS485_CLASH_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for rs485_clash_int_raw when rs485_clash_int_ena is set to 1.
